description: 112 West 13th Street is a rare offering: a 20-foot-wide, five-story Greek Revival townhouse built in 1844, set on a beautiful tree-lined block in the heart of Greenwich Village. With its stoop, bay windows, and multiple terraces overlooking a lush private garden , the home radiates the charm and character that define the Village at its most timeless. The house extends across five full floors plus a finished roof deck , and includes an extension on three levels, offering a remarkable scale of indoor and outdoor living for this prime location. A wide brownstone stoop leads into a gracious foyer and on to a magnificent double parlor , distinguished by soaring ceilings, original plasterwork, and ornate pocket doors inset with antique glass. The south-facing bay windows draw in light throughout the day, while the rear parlor opens to a private deck with tranquil views over the deep, landscaped garden — a setting of mature trees and flowering shrubs that feels like a secret park in the middle of downtown. On the upper floors, multiple terraces extend the living space outdoors and frame garden vistas. A skylit artist’s studio crowns the home on the fifth floor, leading to a rooftop deck with open views of the Empire State Building and the city skyline. Over the years, the townhouse has been a haven for creativity and a backdrop for a vibrant social life. International artists, filmmakers, and musicians have called it home. FOURTH FLOOR: A lovely south-facing bedroom suite with private bathroom and enormous terrace overlooking the neighborhood gardens is just one of three bedrooms located on this floor, which share an additional bathroom. There is also a full-sized washer/dryer on this floor. PENTHOUSE/5th FLOOR: This light-filled room is accessible via elevator making it a convenient and wonderful addition, with a small terrace to the south and a larger terrace to the north. This floor is currently set up as an office/den. Skylights on this floor transport light all the way down through the stairway to the Parlor floor. Please inquire for additional details and to schedule a private showing!

description: For additional perspective on this home, be sure to watch the video. First Showings will be Sunday, Oct 5th.   Right in the heart of New York is Washington Square Park, a neighborhood gathering place cherished for its vibrant energy and artistic legacy. Here, on its 100th anniversary, is 32 Washington Square West, one of the premier full service downtown prewar cooperatives.   Within, we find this thoughtfully renovated 7 room, 3 bedroom, 3 bath home; where great attention was placed on every detail. Upon entering, you're struck by the streams of sun and light provided from innumerable outward facing windows and four exposures .   As you traverse the commodious double-wide living space , you're seduced, and recognize that you're actually, tranquilly, hovering over the park itself. It's vibrancy sweetly softened by the trees and the high floor. These open North, East and South exposures keep you inspired throughout the day, whether your relaxing in the living room, cooking dinner in the open chef's kitchen with top of the line appliances and center island, dining and entertaining, tending to the days tasks or even retiring for the evening. This home further features, traditional moldings, stunning hardwood floors, and a working gas fireplace; there's also central air-conditioning and your own private washer and dryer and storage unit. & nbsp;   All of this is captured in this classic prewar cooperative in the heart of legendary Greenwich Village, a neighborhood which defines what it means to live among the art, culture, history and the here and now of New York City. & nbsp; The building was built in 1925 and is a full service building which includes a 24-hour doorman, live-in super, storage space and a gym. This home is accompanied with its own private storage unit as well. Pets are allowed. & nbsp; The & nbsp; flip tax is 2% of the purchase price paid by the purchaser.   Welcome home!

description: Sunny West-Facing One-Bedroom Condominium at The Grand Chelsea  APARTMENT This inviting one-bedroom home at The Grand Chelsea offers an ideal combination of light, space, and function. With a west-facing exposure , the apartment is sun-flooded throughout the day and features a spacious comfortable layout. The well-proportioned living room is enhanced by a functional pass-through kitchen, designed for both everyday convenience and entertaining. The bath has been renovated with new fixtures and beautiful tiling that brings a modern touch, while ample closets throughout the apartment ensure excellent storage. The large bedroom comfortably accommodates a king-size bed and additional furnishings, creating a true retreat within the city. A thoughtfully designed layout maximizes both flow and usability. BUILDING  &  NEIGHBORHOOD Nestled in the vibrant heart of New York’s Chelsea neighborhood at the corner of 17th Street and Eighth Avenue, The Grand Chelsea Condominium offers an unparalleled living experience. This full-service building boasts 157 units across 21 stories, each exuding contemporary elegance and urban sophistication. Convenience is key, with iconic landmarks such as the High Line and Meatpacking District just a stone's throw away. Indulge your palate at renowned eateries like Cookshop, Shukette, and Jack's Wife Freda, or explore the latest trends in the neighborhood's diverse array of shops. Commuting is a breeze, thanks to easy access to multiple subway lines including A, C, L, 1, 2, 3, as well as bus routes, ensuring you're always well-connected to the city's pulse. Embrace the cultural scene with Chelsea Market and art galleries lining 10th Avenue, promising endless opportunities for exploration and discovery. For that buyer who wants to live in the heart of New York’s Chelsea neighborhood please look no further. There is an additional monthly assessment of $296.91.

title: Payment calculator
description: The Greenwich Lane | West Village Sophistication with Iconic Views  Perched on the 10th floor of 160 West 12th Street at The Greenwich Lane, this 2,904 SF residence with a 552 SF landscaped terrace offers the ultimate blend of scale, design, and protected views . With stunning north and south exposures, three bedrooms, three-and-a-half bathrooms, a library, and interiors meticulously custom-designed by Thomas O’Brien of Aero Studios, the home is defined by its perfect layout and seamless flow - a rare combination in downtown living. The experience begins with a showstopping floorplan which provides for utmost privacy and grand-scale entertainment. The nearly 600sf great room , custom-designed kitchen , and one of the bedrooms all open to the sprawling south-facing terrace. Professionally landscaped and maintained, the terrace spans the entire length of the apartment, providing endless enjoyment of quiet conversation, beautiful dinners, social gatherings and more - all the while gazing at unobstructed views of the Freedom Tower and Lower Manhattan. Equally as impressive are the views to the north which include beautifully framed views of the Empire State Building. The protected panoramas are rare, iconic, and enduring. The windowed chef’s kitchen is just one heart of this special home. Perfectly laid out with beautiful doors to the terrace, it is a showpiece in itself. The custom kitchen features professional-grade appliances , bespoke cabinetry , lots of storage, and a pantry with wine cooler. Your culinary wish has been answered. The north-facing primary suite is grand and refined, with dual custom closets, and an elegant windowed 5-fixture en-suite marble bath with picture perfect views. The secondary bedrooms are graciously sized with en-suite baths and beautiful views. The wood-paneled library/TV room offers an intimate retreat and is easily convertible to a fourth bedroom. It's an incredibly zen room and the perfect private getaway. Thoughtful details abound throughout: coffered ceilings, bespoke millwork, and built-in art display cases. The discreet in-wall Sonos sound system enriches the living room, dining room, library, and kitchen. There is also multi-zone central air and heat as well as a home-sized laundry room. In addition, this special home also comes with a coveted parking space and private storage unit ($724.41/month). Residents of The Greenwich Lane enjoy unparalleled white-glove service with full-time concierge and doorman, a resident manager, and unmatched amenities that include a 25-meter swimming pool and hot tub, state-of-the-art fitness and wellness center with yoga and treatment rooms, golf simulator, screening room, children’s playroom, and a lush central garden. Live in one of the most coveted buildings in one of the most coveted locations of New York City. Shown by appointment only.
